Meeting Title: TSP Rocky Habitat Public Comment Event
Short Description: A meeting to discuss amendments to the Rocky Habitat Management Strategy.
Meeting Location: Online
Details:
Oregon Coastal Management Program staff will be hosting an ONLINE public information WEBINAR to provide context and background information to the updates to Part Three of the Territorial Sea Plan - The Rocky Habitat Management Strategy.

The presentation will also include a demonstration and guided walk-thru of the new Rocky Habitat Web Mapping Tool.

Interested members of the public are welcome to submit comments on the draft strategy during the Q&A session following the presentation.

Meeting Title: Oregon's New Housing Initiatives: How Will They Affect Our Communties
Meeting Location: Council Chambers at Kent Taylor Civic Hall 200 NE 2nd Street
Details:
Join Department of Land Conservation and Development (DLDC) staff and local leaders to discuss new housing initiatives in Oregon. DLCD is holding roundtable discussions to collect guidance and hear concerns from affected communities as the state advances our shared work to encourage a variety of housing types to provide residents more diverse housing choices.
Why now? The Oregon Legislature passed two significant housing bills this past legislative session – House Bill 2001 and 2003. The legislature passed these bills to provide additional housing and to help ensure housing production in addition to zoning. 
Purpose: To provide community members and city staff information about two new housing bills and receive community guidance on issues that should be considered early in the process.

Contacts: 
Ethan Stuckmayer
DLCD Senior Housing Planner
ethan.stuckmayer@state.or.us
503-934-0619	

Angela Carnahan
DLCD Regional Representative
angela.carnahan@state.or.us
503-934-0056	

Heather Richards, PCED
McMinnville Planning Director
hrichards@micminnvilleoregon.org
503-474-5107
 
Information on these bills is included in “Latest News and Events” on DLCD’s website.

Written comments are welcome to housing@dlcd.state.or.us

For information on other housing related community events being held by DLCD through early 2020, see the Housing page on DLCD’s website. Sign up on DLCD’s website to receive further information on housing as this work progresses.

Meeting Title: BOEM and Oregon Intergovernmental Task Force
Short Description: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management and State of Oregon Intergovernmental Task Force on Marine Renewable Energy.
Meeting Location: Portland State Office Building -  800 NE Oregon St
Details: BOEM and the State of Oregon are resuming planning for ocean renewable energy, and the BOEM Oregon Intergovernmental Renewable Energy Task Force is an important component in the process. In addition to providing an update on BOEM activities and an overview of the offshore renewable energy leasing process, BOEM and the State are engaging with the Task Force to begin offshore wind planning in southern Oregon where the wind resource is the strongest in the State. Members of the public are invited to attend.

Meeting Title: Land Conservation and Development Commission Meeting
Short Description: Special hearing: Petition for Enforcement - City of Eugene
Meeting Location: Basement Hearing Room, 635 Capitol St. NE
Details: The commission will decide whether there is good cause to proceed to a contested-case hearing regarding a petition for enforcement alleging the City of Eugene has failed to regulate or prohibit short-term rental uses in its R-1 low density housing zoning district. The commission will make a decision, based on whether there is good cause to either proceed to a contested-case hearing or deny the petition pursuant to OAR 660-045-0090(5) and (6). Only the Department of Land Conservation and Development and parties to the proceeding may present testimony during the good-cause hearing. (OAR 660-045-0090(2)).
Public Comment Accepted: Limited testimony will be accepted, as described above

Short Description: Regular meeting of the Land Conservation and Development Commission
Meeting Location: Basement Hearing Room, 635 Capitol St. NE
Rainbow Room at the Agate Beach Best Western, 3019 N Coast Hwy
Details: The fourth meeting of the group will be taking place on Wednesday, May 22nd from 12:30 to 4pm. Meeting location is the Rainbow Room at the Agate Beach Best Western Hotel in Newport, OR. This meeting will focus on the potential inclusion of small vacant in-fill lots that existed as of January 1, 1977 to be eligible to apply for shoreline armoring permits. Meeting agenda is available on the DLCD website. The meeting is open to the public for observation and there will be a dedicated time for public comment scheduled on the agenda (three minutes per person, as time allows). Members of the public may also submit written comments electronically to dlcd.goal18@state.or.us at any time. All submitted comments will be made available to focus group members.

Short Description: Public Scoping meeting for the Amendment of the Rocky Shores Management Strategy (TSP Part 3)
Meeting Location: Chetco Community Public Library, Myrtlewood Room, 405 Alder Street
Details:
In fall 2018, DLCD will gather decision makers across the state to continue an amendment to the Rocky Shores management chapter (Part III) of the Oregon Territorial Sea Plan (TSP). The plan acts as a coordinated vision for Oregon coastal resources and guides the actions of state and federal agencies that are responsible for managing coastal and ocean resources in the public trust. The amended rocky shores plan will incorporate the best available science and consider the needs, concerns, and values of Oregonians balanced with the state’s goals for a resilient coastal ecosystem that can provide enduring opportunities for its users.

This meeting is designed to get public input about that process, and to understand concerns or issues about management of Oregon's rocky shores.
